trans-unit.source: Use Apache Spark to build machine learning applications on HDInsight | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Use Apache Spark to build machine learning applications on HDInsight | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Step-by-step instructions on how to use notebooks with Apache Spark to build machine learning applications
trans-unit.target: Step-by-step instructions on how to use notebooks with Apache Spark to build machine learning applications

trans-unit.source: Build Machine Learning applications using Apache Spark on Azure HDInsight (Windows)
trans-unit.target: Build Machine Learning applications using Apache Spark on Azure HDInsight (Windows)

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] HDInsight now provides Spark clusters on Linux.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] HDInsight now provides Spark clusters on Linux.

trans-unit.source: For information on how to create a machine learning application on HDInsight Spark Linux clusters, see [Build Machine Learning applications using Apache Spark on Azure HDInsight (Linux)](hdinsight-apache-spark-ipython-notebook-machine-learning.md).
trans-unit.target: For information on how to create a machine learning application on HDInsight Spark Linux clusters, see [Build Machine Learning applications using Apache Spark on Azure HDInsight (Linux)](hdinsight-apache-spark-ipython-notebook-machine-learning.md).

trans-unit.source: Learn how to build a machine learning application using an Apache Spark cluster in HDInsight.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to build a machine learning application using an Apache Spark cluster in HDInsight.

trans-unit.source: This article shows how to use the Jupyter notebook available with the cluster to build and test our application.
trans-unit.target: This article shows how to use the Jupyter notebook available with the cluster to build and test our application.

trans-unit.source: The application uses the sample HVAC.csv data that is available on all clusters by default.
trans-unit.target: The application uses the sample HVAC.csv data that is available on all clusters by default.

trans-unit.source: **Prerequisites:**
trans-unit.target: **Prerequisites:**

trans-unit.source: You must have the following:
trans-unit.target: You must have the following:

trans-unit.source: An Azure subscription.
trans-unit.target: An Azure subscription.

trans-unit.source: See [Get Azure free trial](https://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/videos/get-azure-free-trial-for-testing-hadoop-in-hdinsight/).
trans-unit.target: See [Get Azure free trial](https://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/videos/get-azure-free-trial-for-testing-hadoop-in-hdinsight/).

trans-unit.source: An Apache Spark cluster.
trans-unit.target: An Apache Spark cluster.

trans-unit.source: For instructions, see [Create Apache Spark clusters in Azure HDInsight](hdinsight-apache-spark-provision-clusters.md).
trans-unit.target: For instructions, see [Create Apache Spark clusters in Azure HDInsight](hdinsight-apache-spark-provision-clusters.md).

trans-unit.source: Show me the data
trans-unit.target: Show me the data

trans-unit.source: Before we start building the application, let us understand the structure of the data and the kind of analysis we will do on the data.
trans-unit.target: Before we start building the application, let us understand the structure of the data and the kind of analysis we will do on the data.

trans-unit.source: In this article, we use the sample **HVAC.csv** data file that is available on all HDInsight clusters by default at **\HdiSamples\SensorSampleData\hvac**.
trans-unit.target: In this article, we use the sample **HVAC.csv** data file that is available on all HDInsight clusters by default at **\HdiSamples\SensorSampleData\hvac**.

trans-unit.source: Download and open the CSV file to get a snapshot of the data.
trans-unit.target: Download and open the CSV file to get a snapshot of the data.

trans-unit.source: ![HVAC data snapshot](./media/hdinsight-apache-spark-ipython-notebook-machine-learning-v1/hdispark.ml.show.data.png "Snapshot of the HVAC data")
trans-unit.target: ![HVAC data snapshot](./media/hdinsight-apache-spark-ipython-notebook-machine-learning-v1/hdispark.ml.show.data.png "Snapshot of the HVAC data")

trans-unit.source: The data shows the target temperature and the actual temperature of a building that has HVAC systems installed.
trans-unit.target: The data shows the target temperature and the actual temperature of a building that has HVAC systems installed.

trans-unit.source: Let's assume the **System** column represents the system ID and the **SystemAge** column represents the number of years the HVAC system has been in place at the building.
trans-unit.target: Let's assume the **System** column represents the system ID and the **SystemAge** column represents the number of years the HVAC system has been in place at the building.

trans-unit.source: We use this data to predict whether a building will be hotter or colder based on the target temperature, given a system ID and system age.
trans-unit.target: We use this data to predict whether a building will be hotter or colder based on the target temperature, given a system ID and system age.

trans-unit.source: Write a machine learning application using Spark MLlib
trans-unit.target: Write a machine learning application using Spark MLlib

trans-unit.source: From the [Azure Preview Portal](https://portal.azure.com/), from the startboard, click the tile for your Spark cluster (if you pinned it to the startboard).
trans-unit.target: From the [Azure Preview Portal](https://portal.azure.com/), from the startboard, click the tile for your Spark cluster (if you pinned it to the startboard).

trans-unit.source: You can also navigate to your cluster under **Browse All** > **HDInsight Clusters**.
trans-unit.target: You can also navigate to your cluster under **Browse All** > **HDInsight Clusters**.

trans-unit.source: From the Spark cluster blade, click **Quick Links**, and then from the **Cluster Dashboard** blade, click **Jupyter Notebook**.
trans-unit.target: From the Spark cluster blade, click **Quick Links**, and then from the **Cluster Dashboard** blade, click **Jupyter Notebook**.

trans-unit.source: If prompted, enter the admin credentials for the cluster.
trans-unit.target: If prompted, enter the admin credentials for the cluster.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] You may also reach the Jupyter Notebook for your cluster by opening the following URL in your browser.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] You may also reach the Jupyter Notebook for your cluster by opening the following URL in your browser.

trans-unit.source: Replace __CLUSTERNAME__ with the name of your cluster:
trans-unit.target: Replace __CLUSTERNAME__ with the name of your cluster:

trans-unit.source: Create a new notebook.
trans-unit.target: Create a new notebook.

trans-unit.source: Click **New**, and then click **Python 2**.
trans-unit.target: Click **New**, and then click **Python 2**.

trans-unit.source: ![Create a new Jupyter notebook](./media/hdinsight-apache-spark-ipython-notebook-machine-learning-v1/hdispark.note.jupyter.createnotebook.png "Create a new Jupyter notebook")
trans-unit.target: ![Create a new Jupyter notebook](./media/hdinsight-apache-spark-ipython-notebook-machine-learning-v1/hdispark.note.jupyter.createnotebook.png "Create a new Jupyter notebook")

trans-unit.source: A new notebook is created and opened with the name Untitled.pynb.
trans-unit.target: A new notebook is created and opened with the name Untitled.pynb.

trans-unit.source: Click the notebook name at the top, and enter a friendly name.
trans-unit.target: Click the notebook name at the top, and enter a friendly name.

trans-unit.source: ![Provide a name for the notebook](./media/hdinsight-apache-spark-ipython-notebook-machine-learning-v1/hdispark.note.jupyter.notebook.name.png "Provide a name for the notebook")
trans-unit.target: ![Provide a name for the notebook](./media/hdinsight-apache-spark-ipython-notebook-machine-learning-v1/hdispark.note.jupyter.notebook.name.png "Provide a name for the notebook")

trans-unit.source: Start building your machine learning application.
trans-unit.target: Start building your machine learning application.

trans-unit.source: In this application we use a Spark ML pipeline to perform a document classification.
trans-unit.target: In this application we use a Spark ML pipeline to perform a document classification.

trans-unit.source: In the pipeline, we split the document into words, convert the words into a numerical feature vector, and finally build a prediction model using the feature vectors and labels.
trans-unit.target: In the pipeline, we split the document into words, convert the words into a numerical feature vector, and finally build a prediction model using the feature vectors and labels.

trans-unit.source: To start building the application, first import the required modules and assign resources to the application.
trans-unit.target: To start building the application, first import the required modules and assign resources to the application.

trans-unit.source: In the empty cell in the new notebook, paste the following snippet, and then press **SHIFT + ENTER**.
trans-unit.target: In the empty cell in the new notebook, paste the following snippet, and then press **SHIFT + ENTER**.

trans-unit.source: You must now load the data (hvac.csv), parse it, and use it to train the model.
trans-unit.target: You must now load the data (hvac.csv), parse it, and use it to train the model.

trans-unit.source: For this, you define a function that checks whether the actual temperature of the building is greater than the target temperature.
trans-unit.target: For this, you define a function that checks whether the actual temperature of the building is greater than the target temperature.

trans-unit.source: If the actual temperature is greater, the building is hot, denoted by the value **1.0**.
trans-unit.target: If the actual temperature is greater, the building is hot, denoted by the value **1.0**.

trans-unit.source: If the actual temperature is lesser, the building is cold, denoted by the value **0.0**.
trans-unit.target: If the actual temperature is lesser, the building is cold, denoted by the value **0.0**.

trans-unit.source: Paste the following snippet in an empty cell and press **SHIFT + ENTER**.
trans-unit.target: Paste the following snippet in an empty cell and press **SHIFT + ENTER**.

trans-unit.source: Configure the Spark machine learning pipeline that consists of three stages: tokenizer, hashingTF, and lr.
trans-unit.target: Configure the Spark machine learning pipeline that consists of three stages: tokenizer, hashingTF, and lr.

trans-unit.source: For more information about what is a pipeline and how it works see Spark machine learning pipeline.
trans-unit.target: For more information about what is a pipeline and how it works see Spark machine learning pipeline.

trans-unit.source: Paste the following snippet in an empty cell and press **SHIFT + ENTER**.
trans-unit.target: Paste the following snippet in an empty cell and press **SHIFT + ENTER**.

trans-unit.source: Fit the pipeline to the training document.
trans-unit.target: Fit the pipeline to the training document.

trans-unit.source: Paste the following snippet in an empty cell and press **SHIFT + ENTER**.
trans-unit.target: Paste the following snippet in an empty cell and press **SHIFT + ENTER**.

trans-unit.source: Verify the training document to checkpoint your progress with the application.
trans-unit.target: Verify the training document to checkpoint your progress with the application.

trans-unit.source: Paste the following snippet in an empty cell and press **SHIFT + ENTER**.
trans-unit.target: Paste the following snippet in an empty cell and press **SHIFT + ENTER**.

trans-unit.source: This should give the output similar to the following:
trans-unit.target: This should give the output similar to the following:

trans-unit.source: Go back and verify the output against the raw CSV file.
trans-unit.target: Go back and verify the output against the raw CSV file.

trans-unit.source: For example, the first row the CSV file has this data:
trans-unit.target: For example, the first row the CSV file has this data:

trans-unit.source: ![HVAC data snapshot](./media/hdinsight-apache-spark-ipython-notebook-machine-learning-v1/hdispark.ml.show.data.first.row.png "Snapshot of the HVAC data")
trans-unit.target: ![HVAC data snapshot](./media/hdinsight-apache-spark-ipython-notebook-machine-learning-v1/hdispark.ml.show.data.first.row.png "Snapshot of the HVAC data")

trans-unit.source: Notice how the actual temperature is less than the target temperature suggesting the building is cold.
trans-unit.target: Notice how the actual temperature is less than the target temperature suggesting the building is cold.

trans-unit.source: Hence in the training output, the value for **label** in the first row is **0.0**, which means the building is not hot.
trans-unit.target: Hence in the training output, the value for **label** in the first row is **0.0**, which means the building is not hot.

trans-unit.source: Prepare a data set to run the trained model against.
trans-unit.target: Prepare a data set to run the trained model against.

trans-unit.source: To do so, we would pass on a system ID and system age (denoted as **SystemInfo** in the training output), and the model would predict whether the building with that system ID and system age would be hotter (denoted by 1.0) or cooler (denoted by 0.0).
trans-unit.target: To do so, we would pass on a system ID and system age (denoted as **SystemInfo** in the training output), and the model would predict whether the building with that system ID and system age would be hotter (denoted by 1.0) or cooler (denoted by 0.0).

trans-unit.source: Paste the following snippet in an empty cell and press **SHIFT + ENTER**.
trans-unit.target: Paste the following snippet in an empty cell and press **SHIFT + ENTER**.

trans-unit.source: Finally, make predictions on the test data.
trans-unit.target: Finally, make predictions on the test data.

trans-unit.source: Paste the following snippet in an empty cell and press **SHIFT + ENTER**.
trans-unit.target: Paste the following snippet in an empty cell and press **SHIFT + ENTER**.

trans-unit.source: You should see an output similar to the following:
trans-unit.target: You should see an output similar to the following:

trans-unit.source: From the first row in the prediction, you can see that for an HVAC system with ID 20 and system age of 25 years, the building will be hot (**prediction=1.0**).
trans-unit.target: From the first row in the prediction, you can see that for an HVAC system with ID 20 and system age of 25 years, the building will be hot (**prediction=1.0**).

trans-unit.source: The first value for DenseVector (0.49999) corresponds to the prediction 0.0 and the second value (0.5001) corresponds to the prediction 1.0.
trans-unit.target: The first value for DenseVector (0.49999) corresponds to the prediction 0.0 and the second value (0.5001) corresponds to the prediction 1.0.

trans-unit.source: In the output, even though the second value is only marginally higher, the model shows **prediction=1.0**.
trans-unit.target: In the output, even though the second value is only marginally higher, the model shows **prediction=1.0**.

trans-unit.source: You can now exit the notebook by restarting the kernel.
trans-unit.target: You can now exit the notebook by restarting the kernel.

trans-unit.source: From the top menu bar, click **Kernel**, click **Restart**, and then click **Restart** again at the prompt.
trans-unit.target: From the top menu bar, click **Kernel**, click **Restart**, and then click **Restart** again at the prompt.

trans-unit.source: ![Restart the Jupyter Kernel](./media/hdinsight-apache-spark-ipython-notebook-machine-learning-v1/hdispark.jupyter.restart.kernel.png "Restart the Jupyter Kernel")
trans-unit.target: ![Restart the Jupyter Kernel](./media/hdinsight-apache-spark-ipython-notebook-machine-learning-v1/hdispark.jupyter.restart.kernel.png "Restart the Jupyter Kernel")

trans-unit.source: Use Anaconda scikit-learn library for Machine Learning
trans-unit.target: Use Anaconda scikit-learn library for Machine Learning

trans-unit.source: Apache Spark clusters on HDInsight include Anaconda libraries.
trans-unit.target: Apache Spark clusters on HDInsight include Anaconda libraries.

trans-unit.source: This also includes the **scikit-learn** library for machine learning.
trans-unit.target: This also includes the **scikit-learn** library for machine learning.

trans-unit.source: The library also includes various data sets that you can use to build sample applications directly from a Jupyter notebook.
trans-unit.target: The library also includes various data sets that you can use to build sample applications directly from a Jupyter notebook.

trans-unit.source: For examples on using the scikit-learn library, see [http://scikit-learn.org/stable/auto_examples/index.html](http://scikit-learn.org/stable/auto_examples/index.html).
trans-unit.target: For examples on using the scikit-learn library, see [http://scikit-learn.org/stable/auto_examples/index.html](http://scikit-learn.org/stable/auto_examples/index.html).
